file_content.text: Thank you.
Much longer and I would have ripped the arms off that Hutt.
No one's going to force you to risk your life in the ring again.
You're safe here.
Would have saved me a bundle.
You should have.
Hah.
Bowdaar likes you, little girl. I will fight fiercely for you.
Bowdaar likes you, small man. I will fight well for you.
I paid good credits for you. Better show me you're worth it.
You owe me.
I was pit champion long before Drooga.
Bowdaar will fight.
But for honor, not to entertain a Hutt!
Well, enjoy your freedom. I saved you the big bunk.
Make yourself at home.
Last ship, I was in the slaves' quarters.
Thank you, Captain.
What about entertaining me?
But I need entertainment, too.
I am a warrior of Kashyyyk.
I am undefeated from here to the edge of the Empire.
I am no one's toy.
Don't start giving conditions. I bought you, and you'll do as I say.
You'll do what I ask.
You bought my freedom, not me.
I will pay my debts.
I have not had a family for a hundred years.
On Kashyyyk, I remember, we spoke of "honor families."
They were bound as close as any child of your body.
Just hearing you compare me to a Wookiee child makes my skin itch.
I'm not your child.
Sister, then. In honor, if not blood.
Brother, then. In honor if not blood.
I think of you as family too, Bowdaar.
Aww, that's sweet.
You honor me, Captain.
You work for me. That's all.
We're not family.
It is more than that to me.
For as long as you or your children need me, I will serve as your protector.
It should be another good century before I lose my edge.
I have learned from fighting with you.
You stay cool, let your enemies batter themselves against you.
Watching you helps me direct my rage. It should serve me, not drive me.
I don't know... you were doing pretty well with the rage thing...
Don't change for me.
I have not given up who I am.
But I fight more wisely for having known you.
My fighting style pretty much comes down to "I really don't like pain."
Fight smarter, not harder.
I do not mind pain.
But it is wise to fight with the mind and not just the hand.
Oh, look. The rage is still there.
Fighting at your side brings me peace. That is a strange feeling.
It's an even stranger thing to say, pal. How does fighting bring you peace?
I'm not sure what you mean.
Anger was all I ever felt in past battles. Anger, and duty.
You spent a hundred years being miserable, pal. You're overdue for a little serenity.
But a good one, right?
That word is too strong. I am... content.
If you're not foaming at the mouth, you're not fighting hard enough.
"Peace" isn't what I want.
You are still alive. I do my job.
For a long time, I fought to repay a debt. Now I fight for a friend.
I never believed I would say those words. Thank you.
Before we joined the Republic, Wookiees did not fall to the Trandoshans.
The Republic asks us to be "civilized." They make us ashamed of our strength.
I've never met a Wookiee who was ashamed of being strong.
Not so I've noticed.
What of being angry?
The Republic would never ask you not to defend yourselves.
Don't blame the Republic.
We used to channel our rage. Now we repress it.
Even on Kashyyyk, we talk about Trandoshans instead of fighting them.
This is why they find us such easy prey.
Wookiees are warriors. You shouldn't give that up for anyone.
Civilization is overrated.
You're right.
Our rage made us who we are.
When we give it up, the Trandoshans are right. We are only prey.
I never enjoyed killing in the arena--except the filthy lizard men. They deserve no mercy.
Trandoshans are a blight on Kashyyyk.
They are vicious, honorless... They hunt us like animals to wear our skins.
Any Trandoshan who comes after your people gets the business end of my blaster.
Not while I'm around.
It is not your fight, friend.
You should appeal to the Republic. They wouldn't allow such atrocities.
Your people need outside help.
We do not need outsiders to protect us!
Trandoshans must learn Wookiees are prey who fight back!
I've met some Trandoshans. You could make a nice pair of gloves from one.
Someone should skin them.
Hah.
I would not stoop to their level. They must learn that we are not prey.
I taught the lizard men to fear us every time I killed one in the arena. Now they know Wookiees are better than them!
That sounds a lot less immature in Shyriiwook.
You're ranting, pal.
That's the truth.
Thank you, Captain.
You saved more than me when you took me from Drooga.
You think winning a pit fight will change an entire species?
Don't be ridiculous.
Trandoshans worship their kills. Hunting is all that matters to them.
I cannot change that.
It is enough to scare them. Only the best should take on a Wookiee.
I do not stop thinking of the gambler. The one who abandoned me to Drooga.
It was my own fault. I chose to go with him.
Last I checked, most slaves don't get to pick their owners.
That's unusual.
You chose him?
My owner then was an Imperial slaver. He used me for hard labor all day. Then the pits at night.
The gambler promised to treat me with honor. Only the best fights.
I convinced my owner I was too dangerous to keep.
Wouldn't take much convincing.
I bet that was easy.
The Imperial was a coward. The gambler paid little for me.
How did you end up with Drooga?
What happened then?
Let me guess, he never intended to keep his promise.
He sold you a line.
After my first fight, he forgot me.
I sat in his hold for months, then he dumped me with Drooga. To cover a gambling debt!
Better to stay an Imperial slave.
Quit complaining, you big whiner. It's over.
Just get over it.
Not for me.
Finally, with you, I am a person.
For a century, I was property. A weapon.
Something you could trade, like your gun, for something better.
Hey, don't go insulting my piece. She's gotten me through a lot.
Nothing better than my gun!
Hah.
You're a softie, Captain.
You won't give up a blaster. You would never give up a friend.
Guns don't get hurt if you sell them.
You are a person.
You understand.
When I see slaves now... my rage for their masters burns hot.
I am already too used to my freedom.
If it makes you more comfortable, I'll keep my eye out for a better Wookiee.
Nothing's changed.
Don't you dare!
This is no subject for jokes.
It is still a gift to say "no."
Sometimes I forget. I think I am a slave.
Then it is like the sun rising.
I'm generally pro-freedom. And pro-sun. I like suns.
Glad to help.
What was it like?
Tell me about it.
Slavery is the worst kind of suffering.
You can die nobly and be happy. Slavery destroys all that is good.
I will die before I am a slave again.
Yeah, yeah. You were a slave. Next topic, please.
Quit harping on that.
No.
I was right. That is fun.
I am thinking what I owe you.
On Kashyyyk, we spoke of "life debts."
A Wookiee whose life was saved, owed his service for life.
Is that what you owe me?
Life debts, huh?
That sounds like slavery. Or, worse, marriage. No thanks.
I wouldn't ask that of you.
I have been a slave. I would not do it again for any debt.
I do honor you. I will not leave lightly.
Is there something you need to be happier here?
Are you asking for something?
I've got no hold on you.
You're a free man.
Thank you.
You serve the Republic. You fill your pockets. Both are good.
But there is more. Others suffer while I am free.
I would help them if I can.
Are you saying you'll walk out if I do something you don't like?
What does that mean?
Not until my debt is paid.
Please tell me you're not going to start teaching me about Wookiee culture.
I don't care.
I do not know enough to teach.
I am trying to remember Kashyyyk.
I saw so many worlds as a slave.
It is hard to remember home.
You tell me what a Wookiee might want to buy, I could arrange a run there.
Do you want to go back?
There is nothing there for me.
How did you become a slave?
What happened?
By force. How else?
I was taken as a child. I had just begun to train.
Slavers attacked. I killed four before they shackled me.
I can't imagine Wookiees make good slaves.
Why you?
I'm sorry.
Slavers seek our strength. And bind us with our honor.
I was a slave a hundred years. I stayed sane knowing some things I would die before I'd do.
Luckily, someone else usually died first.
I freed you, what else do you want?
Quit complaining.
I ask for nothing more.
Nostalgia sounds even worse in Wookiee.
Save your breath.
I will keep my thoughts to myself.
We should talk. On the ship.
I want to talk.
Not now.
I didn't pay good money for a happy Wookiee.
Keep your rage.
My life was in no danger from Drooga.
All your talk is boring me.
You turn bad luck to good.
I hunger for a worthy foe.
This galaxy belongs to us.
Where you lead, I follow--and protect.
I watch your back. Focus on what's ahead.
Let's find someone who deserves a beating.
We profit from crushing enemies. It is a good life.
You honor Bowdaar with freedom. Bowdaar honors you with strength.
Show me your enemies. I will break them.
Facing an endless army of worthy foes under an open sky. That is my dream.
Never drop your guard. There is always danger.
As long as I have hands, I need no weapon.
To fight at your side is never dull.
Bring on the next foe!
